alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 8:12PM CDT until May 22 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Lawrence and Independence Counties. Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D affecting Calhoun, Union and Bradley Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Camden affecting Ouachita and Calhoun Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Black Rock. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Farm ground along east bank begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to flood stage just after midnight Saturday night to a crest of 14.0 feet. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date Black River Black Rock 14.0 13.9 Sat 7 PM 13.6 12.7 11.8 14.0 1 AM 5/21 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
